verses.verse: The Song <S%H7892><s%> of songs, <S%H7892><s%> which is Solomon <S%H8010><s%>'s.`Beloved
Let him kiss <S%H5401><s%> me with the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of his mouth; <S%H6310><s%> for your love <S%H1730><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than wine. <S%H3196><s%>

Your oils <S%H8081><s%> have a pleasing <S%H2896><s%> fragrance. <S%H7381><s%> Your name <S%H8034><s%> is oil <S%H8081><s%> poured forth, <S%H7324><s%> therefore the virgins <S%H5959><s%> love you. <S%H157><s%>

Take <S%H4900><s%> me away with <S%H310><s%> you. <S%H7323><s%> Let us hurry. The king <S%H4428><s%> has brought <S%H935><s%> me into his rooms. <S%H2315><s%> Friends We will be glad <S%H1523><s%> and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in you. <S%H2142><s%> We will praise your love <S%H1730><s%> more than wine! <S%H3196><s%> Beloved They are right <S%H4339><s%> to love you. <S%H157><s%>

I am dark, <S%H7838><s%> but lovely, <S%H5000><s%> you daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> like Kedar <S%H6938><s%>'s tents, <S%H168><s%> like Solomon <S%H8010><s%>'s curtains. <S%H3407><s%>

Don't <S%H7200><s%> stare at me because I am dark, <S%H7840><s%> because the sun <S%H8121><s%> has scorched <S%H7805><s%> me. <S%H517><s%> My mother's sons <S%H1121><s%> were angry <S%H2787><s%> with me. <S%H7760><s%> They made me keeper <S%H5201><s%> of the vineyards. <S%H3754><s%> I haven't <S%H5201><s%> kept my own vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>

Tell <S%H5046><s%> me, <S%H5315><s%> you whom my soul loves, <S%H157><s%> where <S%H349><s%> you graze <S%H7462><s%> your flock, <S%H349><s%> where you rest <S%H7257><s%> them at noon; <S%H6672><s%> For <S%H4100><s%> why should I be as one who is veiled beside the flocks <S%H5739><s%> of your companions? <S%H2270><s%> Lover

If you don't <S%H3045><s%> know, most beautiful <S%H3303><s%> among women, <S%H802><s%> follow <S%H3318><s%> the tracks <S%H6119><s%> of the sheep. <S%H6629><s%> Graze <S%H7462><s%> your young goats <S%H1429><s%> beside the shepherds <S%H7462><s%>' tents. <S%H4908><s%>
I have compared <S%H1819><s%> you, <S%H7474><s%> my love, to a steed <S%H5484><s%> in Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s chariots. <S%H7393><s%>
Your cheeks <S%H3895><s%> are beautiful <S%H4998><s%> with earrings, <S%H8447><s%> your neck <S%H6677><s%> with strings of jewels. <S%H2737><s%>
We will make <S%H6213><s%> you earrings <S%H8447><s%> of gold, <S%H2091><s%> with studs <S%H5351><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%> Beloved
While the king <S%H4428><s%> sat at his table, <S%H4524><s%> my perfume <S%H5373><s%> spread <S%H5414><s%> its fragrance. <S%H7381><s%>
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is to me a sachet <S%H6872><s%> of myrrh, <S%H4753><s%> that lies <S%H3885><s%> between my breasts. <S%H7699><s%>
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is to me a cluster <S%H811><s%> of henna blossoms <S%H3724><s%> from the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> of En Gedi. <S%H5872><s%> Lover
Behold, <S%H3303><s%> you are beautiful, my love. <S%H7474><s%> Behold, <S%H3303><s%> you are beautiful. Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> are doves. <S%H3123><s%> Beloved
Behold, <S%H3303><s%> you are beautiful, my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> yes, <S%H5273><s%> pleasant; and our couch <S%H6210><s%> is verdant. <S%H7488><s%> Lover
The beams <S%H6982><s%> of our house <S%H1004><s%> are cedars. <S%H730><s%> Our rafters <S%H7351><s%> are firs. <S%H1266><s%>
